content: color change will result in a hat *knit 2 rounds in cc knit 2 rounds in mc* repeat until hat jog in color at the end of round personally measures 3 5 4 4 5 5 inches from cast-on edge i m ok with that jogging is good for you be top decreases continue color changes every second round and sure to get a good gauge when starting with a decrease 8 stitches every other row as follows new color by stretching the hat down while gently tugging the working yarn up to leave a round 1 *k5 k6 k7 k8 k2tog pm* repeat around 2-row high float between stripes when round 2 knit starting the second round of a color i keep my round 3 *k to 2 stitches before marker k2tog sm* repeat around working yarn above the yarn from the previous round 4 knit stripe repeat rnds 3 and 4 ending after round 4 with 16 stitches jogless options if the jogs really bug you you remaining continuing color changes *k2tog* around for 2 can do jogless joins see rounds leaving 4 stitches http //techknitting blogspot com/2007/01/jogle i-cord loop in mc or cc as desired work remaining 4 stitches in slip_stitch-stripes html by slipping the first stitch of i-cord for 3 inches cut yarn and pull tail through all 4 stitches the second round of each color and optionally from right to left thread tail between stitches at the base of i- shifting the end of round marker one stitch to cord to the inside of hat pull tightly and secure by sewing tail the left i e after the slipped stitch through the tip of i-cord and the back of stitches inside hat finishing weave in all ends securely copyright 2011 by tracey kay for teekay knits freely distributed for private use only the pattern photos and products made from the pattern may not be used for commercial purposes without the written consent of the designer please send questions or comments to teekayknits@yahoo com teekay knits august 2011 ver 1 0 page 2/2
